page.title: 12The Northern Bypass
page.content:
The bypass is being built to relieve traffic from the centre of Horsham. Most of the traffic that goes through Horsham comes from other towns to Crawley, Gatwick and Brighton via Horsham. The bypass will pass through farmland mostly rough grazing and silage, but some fields are used for crops. The bypass will measure about 5 kilometres when it is finished in about 5 years.
There are lots of different machines being used including bulldozers, rollers and cranes. The contractors are having to bank it up because the ground is uneven and they have to make a bridge to go over the main line railway. They are also building a roundabout to join the bridge to the existing Crawley road. The noise and dust annoys people who live nearby.
